text:
Hi all, unfortunately the R dev day after posit::conf is restricted to invite only as we have quite limited spots - as <@U03CYLHAE4T> guessed, we are piggy-backing on the Tidyverse Dev Day event and Posit offered us 16 spots for people to work on base R contribution. With help from <@U051BH4JSS3> we invited a range of folk, mainly building on previous involvement in R Contributor initiatives (e.g. the R Project Sprint, C Study Group, etc), aiming to get a range of experience and diverse demographics. Potentially if people are signed up to the Tidyverse Dev Day and want to swap into the R Dev Day that may be possible, but this can't be a free-for-all as we also only have limited R Core members attending (2 in person, 1 remote) and limited tasks prepared, so most people will need to have some experience of R contribution for the event to run effectively. Sorry we can't be more open and inclusive in this case!

That said, I do have one free slot left and I'm happy to offer that to you <@U062MDESA6S>, so please go ahead and register (note that 3 tickets show as available because 2 invited folk have not registered, I have to chase them up!).

text:
Thanks for clarifying <@U01DZUA88S1>

In that case, I absolutely don't mind sitting this one out. I would much prefer that the event focus on bringing people into the R developer ecosystem and devoting the appropriate attention to them. Even with open tickets, I fully support using those to solicit involvement from newer entrants into the community who might not have as many inroads to contribution.

I look forward to meeting you all in person at the conference :rocket: :partyr:
